SENT.plain: Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common arrhythmia in athletes
Evidence supports that it occurs more frequently in endurance athletes than in nonathletes and that it can result in decreased performance or even ineligibility for athletes
Although there is no clear etiology of why the increase in athletes exists, three supported mechanisms include morphologic adaptation, autonomic alteration, and chronic systemic inflammation
Although treatment in athletes can be challenging, type 1C antiarrhythmics are accepted generally as a first-line therapy in addition to risk factor-based anticoagulation

Radiofrequency catheter ablation also has become a recommended treatment for symptomatic paroxysmal AF that is refractory to at least one class 1 or 3 antiarrhythmic medication and a reasonable treatment in symptomatic paroxysmal AF prior to initiation of antiarrhythmic therapy
